WRD_GaleBombOption.synopsis: The Emperor or Orpheus has just discussed the players options to either transform or hand over the netherstones. If Gale is willing to use his bomb, Gale will remind the player that he is willing to blow up as a possible solution. The player cannot rely on it as their only solution, but will be prompted to decide when they decide to climb up the Netherbrain.
WRD_GaleBombOption.how_to_trigger: Load END_Maindebug recruit Galeoe end_startillithidoptionsProceed to Assimilation dialog Select "I can keep the stones if I transform"Wait for Gale dialog to become available

WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice.synopsis: The Emperor has just provided the avatar the option to transform into a mind flayer in order to use the Netherstones to defeat the Netherbrain. Karlach is dying, so knowing this she offers the player to take their place as a mind flayer.
WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice.how_to_trigger: Load END_Maindebug recruit Karlachoe end_startillithidoptionsTalk to the Emperor by OrpheusChoose the option to show interest in transformingDialog should break out and trigger the WRD

WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice.synopsis: The Emperor has just provided the avatar the option to transform into a mind flayer in order to use the Netherstones to defeat the Netherbrain. Gale has an interest in getting the crown, meaning he needs the stones, so transforming into a mind flayer is probably his best chance to getting it.
WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice.how_to_trigger: Load END_Maindebug recruit Galeset ORI_Gale_State_WillingForCrownoe end_startillithidoptionsTalk to the Emperor by OrpheusChoose the option to show interest in transformingDialog should break out and trigger the WRD

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice.synopsis: The Emperor has given the player a moment to talk with their party before choosing what to do (transform into a mind flayer, assimilate orpheus). If Lae'zel is on the Vlaakith path, she will have her own dialog instead of a discussion with the entire party,
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice.how_to_trigger: load END_Maindebug recruit Lae'zel & KarlachProceed to Astral PlaneSpeak with Emperor till he offers the option to transformDialog should become available after the Emperor temporarly ends the dialog

WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed.synopsis: Laezel WRD about the remaining choices after causing the Emperor to leave.Short version plays if the LaezelTadpoleChoice WRD already played
WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed.how_to_trigger: load END_Maindebug recruit Lae'zelProceed to Astral PlaneAttack the emperor when he's with Orpheus before or after speaking to himIf Rapahel appears, talk to him and this will play afterwardsIf Raphael does not appear, this will be available after the Emperor leaves

WRD_GaleBombOption_4.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleBombOption_4.text: An easy proposition for the Emperor to make - 'become a mind flayer' - it has no soul to sacrifice.

WRD_GaleBombOption_18.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleBombOption_18.text: If it did - perhaps it would understand the weight of what it's asking of us. And why we might seek an alternative.
WRD_GaleBombOption_18.context: NodeContext: 'what else we're capable of giving' referring to the possibility of sacrificing himself for the good of all. He's talking about what a mind flayer probably doesn't understand about humans - the capacity for self-sacrifice.

WRD_GaleBombOption_15.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleBombOption_15.text: The thought must have crossed your mind? It has certainly weighed on mine.

WRD_GaleBombOption_5.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleBombOption_5.text: I know, we've been through this before. But our situation has changed since then, and not for the better.

WRD_GaleBombOption_33.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleBombOption_33.text: I think it's time we reconsider the orb.

WRD_GaleBombOption_39.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleBombOption_39.text: With its power, I could put an end to this whole thing - Crown, Netherbrain, Absolute. Everything.

WRD_GaleBombOption_38.speaker: Player
WRD_GaleBombOption_38.text: You'd truly sacrifice yourself for us?

WRD_GaleBombOption_30.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleBombOption_30.text: If I'm destined to die, I can think of worse ways. At least if I use the orb, I can ensure the brain dies with me.
WRD_GaleBombOption_30.context: NodeContext: with a sad knowing smile

WRD_GaleBombOption_19.speaker: Player
WRD_GaleBombOption_19.text: You might be eager to die in a blaze of glory, but I'm not. You'd kill me as well.

WRD_GaleBombOption_41.speaker: Player
WRD_GaleBombOption_41.text: You would rather end your own life than trust the Emperor with the stones?

WRD_GaleBombOption_7.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleBombOption_7.text: The real question is, do you trust me?
WRD_GaleBombOption_7.context: NodeContext: trust 'me' as opposed to trusting the emperor. Gale wants you to follow the path he's advising

WRD_GaleBombOption_1.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleBombOption_1.text: Do not mistake me - I want to live. But I've been careless enough with my life in the past. I can hardly stand by and watch you sacrifice yours.
WRD_GaleBombOption_1.context: NodeContext: Persuading you of a grim but necessary course of action

WRD_GaleBombOption_26.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleBombOption_26.text: Once I'm in position, I will ensure you are removed to a safe vantage point to watch the fireworks. You need not die alongside me. Nor surrender your soul in becoming an illithid.

WRD_GaleBombOption_11.speaker: Player
WRD_GaleBombOption_11.text: It's okay, Gale. Karlach wants to transform. She'll do it, for herself and for us.

WRD_GaleBombOption_10.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleBombOption_10.text: Then I will hold my peace. But if the time comes when even her sacrifice is not enough, call on me, and I will be ready.

WRD_GaleBombOption_20.speaker: Player
WRD_GaleBombOption_20.text: We should free Orpheus. Then we'll decide.

WRD_GaleBombOption_40.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleBombOption_40.text: If you think it's best, but I hope you're confident in your powers of persuasion. The last thing we need is another enemy to contend with.

WRD_GaleBombOption_36.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleBombOption_36.text: Please - at least consider my offer.

WRD_GaleBombOption_32.speaker: Player
WRD_GaleBombOption_32.text: I could never ask you to make such a sacrifice, Gale.

WRD_GaleBombOption_22.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleBombOption_22.text: Regardless, my offer stands. Should you change your mind, I will not let you down.

WRD_GaleBombOption_24.speaker: Player
WRD_GaleBombOption_24.text: Very well. If the time comes - I'll call on you to use the orb.

WRD_GaleBombOption_13.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleBombOption_13.text: I will not let you down.

WRD_GaleBombOption_3.speaker: Player
WRD_GaleBombOption_3.text: No, Gale - we're not considering it. End of discussion.

WRD_GaleBombOption_2.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleBombOption_2.text: Very well. We'll do this the old fashioned way then - swords, spells and sweat. Adventurers to the end - whatever form it may take.
WRD_GaleBombOption_2.context: NodeContext: Determination in the face of truly formidable odds

WRD_GaleBombOption_35.speaker: Player
WRD_GaleBombOption_35.text: Absolutely not. We came this far together - we're going to survive together too.

WRD_GaleBombOption_31.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleBombOption_31.text: I like the sound of that.

WRD_GaleBombOption_16.speaker: Player
WRD_GaleBombOption_16.text: I understand not trusting the Emperor, but Orpheus loathes illithids. If he insists we transform, it must be the only way.

WRD_GaleBombOption_37.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleBombOption_37.text: Just because we do not like the alternative, does not mean we are not free to choose our course.

WRD_GaleBombOption_29.speaker: Player
WRD_GaleBombOption_29.text: What about Orpheus? If we free him, he might offer another way.

WRD_GaleBombOption_14.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleBombOption_14.text: He is the prince of a people who've spent aeons nursing a hatred of the very creature nestled in our skulls.

WRD_GaleBombOption_21.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleBombOption_21.text: Save him, and who's to say he wouldn't run us through at the first opportunity?

WRD_GaleBombOption_0.speaker: Player
WRD_GaleBombOption_0.text: Mystra will cure you if we bring her the Crown of Karsus. You don't need to do this.

WRD_GaleBombOption_42.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleBombOption_42.text: To cure me of the orb, yes. But what of the guilt of allowing one of my friends to sacrifice their very soul and become illithid?
WRD_GaleBombOption_42.context: NodeContext: Persuading you of a grim but necessary course of action

WRD_GaleBombOption_17.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleBombOption_17.text: Or worse, trusting a mind flayer to wield the stones, and giving it the chance to dominate a Netherbrain?
WRD_GaleBombOption_17.context: NodeContext: Persuading you of a grim but necessary course of action

WRD_GaleBombOption_27.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleBombOption_27.text: Barely woken from his slumber, and already the prince of the githyanki demands one of us surrender our souls in service of him.
WRD_GaleBombOption_27.context: NodeContext: Hint of an eye roll - not surprised

WRD_GaleBombOption_8.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleBombOption_8.text: Make the best decision you can - that's all anyone could ask of you. I will stand by your side regardless.

WRD_GaleBombOption_6.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleBombOption_6.text: No doubt, in the context of aeons of torture, it seems a small ask. But, of course, he does not realise what else we might have to offer.
WRD_GaleBombOption_6.context: NodeContext: Hint of an eye roll - not surprised

WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_5.speaker: Karlach
WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_5.text: The Emperor might be right, but we're not out of options yet.
WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_5.context: InternalNodeContext: Node subject: We have an option: Me

WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_25.speaker: Karlach
WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_25.text: Let me transform. I'm... I'm not long for this world. I can feel it.
WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_25.context: InternalNodeContext: Node subject: Re-establish the Karlach optionNodeContext: The weight behind this is Karlach knows she's gonna die, and that's why she's offering.

WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_0.speaker: Karlach
WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_0.text: You can trust me to use the stones as we planned - to defeat the brain, and nothing more. It's the perfect solution.
WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_0.context: NodeContext: A little sad, but resolute.

WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_2.speaker: Karlach
WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_2.context: InternalNodeContext: Node subject: Direct focus to player. What do you think we should do?NodeContext: Growing resolve.

WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_9.speaker: Player
WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_9.text: This should be my sacrifice to make. Not yours.

WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_7.speaker: Karlach
WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_7.text: Soldier, my heart feels like a live grenade - gonna blow any minute. You still have a life to live. I don't.

WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_8.speaker: Karlach
WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_8.text: Let me do this for you. For me. Please, darling. I want to.
WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_8.context: NodeContext: Her resolve cracks slightly on the 'darling,' an aside to the player if they're in love.

WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_19.speaker: Karlach
WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_19.text: If this is the end for me, let me be the motherfucker who saved the world.
WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_19.context: NodeContext: A return to her swag.

WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_20.speaker: Player
WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_20.text: All right. If this is what you really want, all I can say is thank you.

WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_21.speaker: Karlach
WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_21.context: NodeContext: Full of Bond-like charm. She's just agreed to take on the ultimate sacrifice, and she's doing it with style.

WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_17.speaker: Karlach
WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_17.text: If anyone was gonna look even better with tentacles, it was gonna be me. Let's do this.

WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_15.speaker: Player
WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_15.text: I can't, Karlach. I'm sorry. I want it to be me, not you.

WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_24.speaker: Karlach
WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_24.text: I know you. I know you know your own mind. If this is what you want, then all I can say is give 'em Hell, soldier.

WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_1.speaker: Karlach
WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_1.text: I won't have to look at you much longer anyway, so I'm really getting the good end of the deal.
WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_1.context: NodeContext: Cheekily. Saying she's dying soon so she won't have to see the player be an ugly mind flayer for long. Macabre humor, but she means it affectionately.

WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_12.speaker: Player
WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_12.text: No - none of us is turning into a mind flayer. If that means giving them the stones, then so be it.

WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_3.speaker: Karlach
WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_3.text: I trust you. Do what you think is right, and I'll stand by you.

WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_23.speaker: Karlach
WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_23.text: But if you change your mind, just say so. I'm here. And I'm ready for whatever comes next.

WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_18.speaker: Player
WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_18.text: We should at least free Orpheus first. There might be another solution here.

WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_13.speaker: Player
WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_13.text: If this is the end for you, you should go out as yourself, not a mind flayer.

WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_14.speaker: Karlach
WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_14.text: I'd rather be a mind flayer than have to watch you become one. You still get to live. Do it as you.

WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_4.speaker: Player
WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_4.text: Are you sure this is what you want?

WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_16.speaker: Karlach
WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_16.text: I've never been more sure of anything. This heart inside me is about to blow. Doesn't matter which body it takes out with it, right?

WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_10.speaker: Karlach
WRD_KarlachTadpoleChoice_10.context: NodeContext: Her resolve cracks slightly on the 'darling,' an aside to the player if they're in love.

WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_9.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_9.text: |I'll be straight with you, If I am to have any chance of getting my hands on that crown then my best my best option is to take the stones and transform.|

WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_16.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_16.text: |It's a big risk, I'm well aware, but it's even a greater risk to lose that crown if anything were to happen.|

WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_0.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_0.text: |It's not ideal, but the way I see it we kill two birds with one stone. You get to keep your teeth, and I get some assurance in acquiring the crown.|

WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_14.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_14.text: |I know Karlach has the best intentions, but her kind heart is not going to help me get that crown. Let me do this.|

WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_5.speaker: Player
WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_5.text: |You would really lose your soul for the crown?|

WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_25.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_25.text: |We have a world to save, and I'm the only one here to have something to gain from the transformation.|

WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_18.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_18.text: |You convinced me how important it is, and nothing important is ever easy.|

WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_8.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_8.text: |So keep your face looking pretty as it should, and let me take this one for the team.|

WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_23.speaker: Player
WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_23.text: |This is your moment Gale. Go for it.|

WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_3.speaker: Player
WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_3.text: |I'm sorry Gale, this responsibility is ultimately mine.|

WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_21.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_21.text: |You know what's best. I can't say I'm not saddened, but we wouldn't have gotten this far without you.|

WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_20.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_20.text: |And who knows, maybe being a mind flayer won't be so bad.|

WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_7.speaker: Player
WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_7.text: |None of us need to do this. I'll give the stones to the Emperor.|

WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_12.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_12.text: |After everything and you still trust it. You may see something I don't, but that does not mean you see it none the less.|

WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_17.speaker: Player
WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_17.text: |We have the Orphic hammer, let's exhaust all our options.|

WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_1.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_1.text: |We do, though were not very nice to his friends the last time we were here.|

WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_24.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_24.text: |But till the pin drops, there is always oppertunity for change. Keep me in mind, whichever choice you make.|

WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_11.speaker: Player
WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_11.text: |I think killing the brain is a higher priority to getting an artifact.|

WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_10.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_10.text: |The two are not mutually exclusive. If someone has to change, it would be a shame to place that burden on you for me to swoop in take the reward.|

WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_19.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_19.text: |This also keeps you out of harms way. If I keep listing the benifits I'll run out of birds to kill with my one stone.|

WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_26.speaker: Player
WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_26.text: |Do you really think this is our best option?|

WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_22.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_22.text: |When we speak of our 'best' option, we're not choosing between caviar and foie gras.|

WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_2.speaker: Gale
WRD_GaleTadpoleChoice_2.text: |All our options are not great, but that doesn't mean we should consider these choices with any less gravitas.|

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_4.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_4.text: Mother Gith's only son has suffered long in his prison.

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_27.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_27.text: Refuse the Emperor. Better yet, crush his revolting skull and let this Prism be his grave.

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_20.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_20.text: Then smash the crystals with the Orphic Hammer, and free the Prince from his bonds.

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_24.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_24.text: The Comet will guide us to a sure victory against the brain. Ch'mar, zal'a Orpheus!

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_5.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_5.text: The choice before is clear as a var'ith'n's psi-quartz, inescapable as the expanse of wildspace itself.
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_5.context: NodeContext: VAHR-ith-inn (a kind of psionic builder)

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_52.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_52.text: Smash the crystals with the Orphic Hammer. Once the fell prince is free, we'll strike him down. The Age of Vlaakith will last eternal!

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_54.speaker: Narrator
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_54.text: *Killing Orpheus would leave you without his protection. You would be dooming yourself to be the Netherbrain's thrall.*

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_40.speaker: Narrator
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_40.text: *But within the recesses of your mind, another possibility sparks:*

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_34.speaker: Narrator
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_34.text: *You might break Orpheus free with the hammer and ally with him. Together, you might defeat the Netherbrain.*

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_1.speaker: Narrator
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_1.text: *Afterwards, Lae'zel can strike down Prince Orpheus. Vlaakith's bidding will be done.*

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_37.speaker: Narrator
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_37.text: *Letting him live, however, would surely provoke Lae'zel to attack.*

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_42.speaker: Narrator
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_42.text: *If you speak with Orpheus, you might unveil an option you have yet to consider.*

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_56.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_56.text: To become ghaik - it is an agony that haunts every githyanki's dreams.

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_14.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_14.text: It is the fate you and I have spent countless days trying to avoid since the parasites slithered into our skulls.

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_51.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_51.text: And now it is the fate it seems you must accept, if we're to fell the unfaithful prince and fulfil Vlaakith's mission.

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_61.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_61.text: Assimilate Orpheus, wield his power. Vlaakith's knights will fly to our aid - we will slaughter the brain, end the Grand Design...

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_3.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_3.text: ...and I will speak the Rite of Ascension and fly to the Astral Plane.

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_32.speaker: Player
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_32.text: You could be right. Assimilating Orpheus might be the best option.

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_6.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_6.text: Odious words, but I must speak them: in this matter, I believe the Emperor speaks true.

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_19.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_19.text: But that does not mean I wish an illithid to carry Orpheus' power. Better it lives within you than within it.

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_45.speaker: Player
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_45.text: I'm not so sure. The Emperor offered; we should accept.

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_60.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_60.text: A repugnant choice, a cowardly choice.

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_17.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_17.text: But a choice I will not resist should you make it.

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_43.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_43.text: Protocol Twenty: 'No alliance is above you nor beneath you if in service to Vlaakith's command.'

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_41.speaker: Player
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_41.text: If you're so adamant, why don't you assimilate Orpheus, Lae'zel?

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_22.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_22.text: Tsk'va! Deny my own ascension and become that which Queen Vlaakith abhors?

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_50.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_50.text: If I must be enthralled, then I will at least know the pleasure of tearing the prince apart with my own hands.

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_49.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_49.text: And I will rip apart your own flesh if you refuse me and find a way to let Orpheus go free.

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_13.speaker: Player
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_13.text: I know what I need to do.

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_67.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_67.text: Go. Choose what is right. Choose assimilation.

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_39.speaker: Player
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_39.text: You expect me to make a sacrifice you wouldn't make yourself?

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_63.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_63.text: And you expect me to sacrifice a lifetime of faith? To forget ascension, to give up the very stuff I am made from?

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_25.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_25.text: I would sooner donate my body to the Netherbrain as a ghaik puppet than live some half-life as a tentacled castaway.

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_66.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_66.text: Either Orpheus is assimilated. Or I slay him in Vlaakith's name, and the Netherbrain takes our minds and bodies for its own.

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_33.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_33.text: Either Orpheus is assimilated. Or the Netherbrain takes our minds and bodies for its own.

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_8.speaker: Player
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_8.text: Connect with Lae'zel's mind. Could there be another reason for her refusal?

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_55.speaker: Narrator
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_55.text: *Lae'zel's other reasons for refusing her own assimilation come into focus:*

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_10.speaker: Narrator
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_10.text: *She fears the Emperor's influence on her mind. She trusts you with this power more than she trusts herself.*

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_0.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_0.text: So you've seen the truth. Perhaps I shouldn't have been so shamed by it.

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_46.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_46.text: You led us through briar and bramble, you affirmed my faith when it faltered.

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_2.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_2.text: I hate that this gift must also be such a burden. But I would trust no one else with it.

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_53.speaker: Player
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_53.text: The Emperor could be lying. We could use the hammer to free Orpheus and kill him.

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_9.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_9.text: Refuse assimilation, and we shall do just that. If the Emperor has misled us, our beating hearts and sound minds will be the proof of it.

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_47.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_47.text: If the illithid speaks true and we slay the traitor, we will be lost to the void that is the Netherbrain.

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_35.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_35.text: Odious words, but I must speak them: in this matter alone, I believe the illithid.

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_7.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_7.text: I will fulfil my mission, this much I know. Either Orpheus is assimilated, or I carve him into pieces and we're lost to the Netherbrain's void.

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_64.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_64.text: By Mother Gith's silver blade, are we left with no choice but to assimilate the Prince of the Comet?

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_65.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_65.text: No, for as long as I live, I will not let Gith's only son perish. Let Orpheus be consumed, and I will split both you and the ghaik straight down the middle!

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_29.speaker: Narrator
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_29.text: *Lae'zel's words sound final, but within the recesses of your mind, a realisation sparks:*

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_57.speaker: Narrator
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_57.text: *When you next speak to the Emperor, you might still convince Lae'zel to accept Orpheus' assimilation.*

WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_59.speaker: Narrator
WRD_LaezelTadpoleChoice_59.text: *Lae'zel's words sound final. Any move to assimilate Orpheus could provoke her to attack.*

WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_1.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_1.text: The ghaik is gone. Our mission is set.

WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_35.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_35.text: Smash the crystals with the hammer, and free the Prince of the Comet.

WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_17.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_17.text: Gith's beloved son will lead us to a sure victory against the Netherbrain.

WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_33.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_33.text: Smash the crystals with the hammer, and free the Prince of the Comet.

WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_21.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_21.text: Smash the crystals with the Orphic Hammer. Once the fell prince is free, we'll strike him down. The Age of Vlaakith will last eternal!

WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_3.speaker: Narrator
WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_3.text: *Killing Orpheus would leave you without his protection. You would be dooming yourself to be the Netherbrain's thrall.*

WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_44.speaker: Narrator
WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_44.text: *But within the recesses of your mind, another possibility sparks:*

WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_23.speaker: Narrator
WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_23.text: *You might break Orpheus free with the hammer and ally with him. Together, you might defeat the Netherbrain.*

WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_15.speaker: Narrator
WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_15.text: *Afterwards, Lae'zel can strike him down. Vlaakith's bidding would still be done.*

WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_9.speaker: Narrator
WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_9.text: *Letting him live, however, would surely provoke Lae'zel to attack.*

WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_38.speaker: Narrator
WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_38.text: *If you speak with Orpheus, you might unveil an option you have yet to consider.*

WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_18.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_18.text: The ghaik is gone. We must waste no more time.

WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_4.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_4.text: Take the hammer and smash the crystals binding the Prince of the Comet.

WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_40.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_40.text: And be careful! Do him any harm, and I will bisect you. Mercilessly, torturously, slowly.

WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_0.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_0.text: Break the traitor prince free. It is time he pay penance for his crimes against my people.

WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_22.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_22.text: Use the tadpole, assimilate Orpheus. This is our only choice.

WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_16.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_16.text: O Undying Queen of the noble githyanki, God Regent of the Six Arms of Tu'narath: today, your will is done!

WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_13.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_13.text: Break the traitor prince free. It is time he pay penance for his crimes against my people.

WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_43.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_43.text: By Mother Gith's silver blade, are we left with no choice?

WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_8.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_8.text: Go ahead - assimilate the Prince of the Comet. Mother Gith, may your spirit hear me:

WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_42.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_42.text: Your beloved son will perish in honour, his life given so the Grand Design might be thwarted.

WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_2.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_2.text: Ch'mar, zal'a Gith. Ch'mar, zal'a Gith. Ch'mar, zal'a Gith.
WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_2.context:
NodeContext: As if ending a prayer, with a certain pleading and sadness, but not too much.

cheh-MAR ZAL-ah gith

WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_14.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_14.text: No - I will not accept that. I will not see the Prince of the Comet destroyed.

WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_29.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_29.text: Assimilate Orpheus, and I will rip off your every limb and bask in your agony!
WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_29.context: NodeContext: hatred into self-loathing and resolve

WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_7.speaker: Player
WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_7.text: I know how big this is to you, but trust me Lae'zel. Trust me.

WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_34.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_34.text: We will end the Grand Design. And then we will go our separate ways.

WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_25.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_25.text: O Gith, Great Emancipator, Mother of my people, reveal your light and guide me forward. Yisk Gith'ka tavki krash'ht.

WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_27.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_27.text: No more words. I gave you my trust - and you failed me.

WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_41.speaker: Player
WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_41.text: We have no way to free Orpheus. Assimilation is our only option.

WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_36.speaker: Player
WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_36.text: Fool. You can't defeat the Netherbrain and end the Grand Design on your own.

WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_6.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_6.text: To think I once called you zhak vo'n'fynh duj...

WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_20.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelEmperorBetrayed_20.context: NodeContext: HTA-lak KRITH ma-HAR! - Die, treacherous scum!
